'''Atanatar I''' ([[Quenya|Q]], pron. {{IPA|[aˈtanatar]}}; {{TA|480}}<ref>{{PM|Elendil}}</ref> – {{TA|748|n}},<ref name="South">{{App|South}}</ref> aged 268 years) was the tenth [[King of Gondor]], ruling for 81 years, from Third Age 667 until his death.

==History==
He was the son of [[Turambar (King of Gondor)|Turambar]], the great conqueror of the [[Easterlings]]. Atanatar's reign, however, was uneventful, and he was succeeded by his son [[Siriondil (King of Gondor)|Siriondil]].<ref name="South"/>

==Etymology==
''Atanatar'' is [[Quenya]]. It means "Father of Men".<ref>{{PE|17}}, p. 24 and p. 114</ref> It is a compound of ''[[Atani|Atan]]'' ("Man") and ''[[atar]]'' ("father").<ref>{{webcite|author=Paul Strack|articleurl=https://www.eldamo.org/content/words/word-4233171257.html|articlename=Q. ''Atanatar'' m.|website=Eldamo|accessed=29 October 2021}}</ref>
